info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-rpc - RPC Operations
info.description:
NED RPC YANG module for IOS
     Copyright (c) 2016-2020 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

**Module:** `Cisco-IOS-XE-rpc`
**Version:** 2024-11-01
**Operations:** 21

post.summary: Set a command to its defaults
post.description:
Set a command to its defaults

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/rpc:default`

result.description: Output returned by the network element

iox.description: Clear all IOX data to the default, initial IOX state

result.description: Output returned by the network element
Output returned by the network element
Output returned by the network element

post.summary: Halt and perform a cold restart
post.description:
Halt and perform a cold restart

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/rpc:reload`

force.description: Force a restart even if there is unsaved config

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary: Perform a factory reset of the device
post.description:
Perform a factory reset of the device

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/rpc:factory-reset`

keep-licensing-info.description:
Perform a factory reset of the device. This will
           keep some licensing specific information

all.description:
Perform a factory reset of the device. This will
           restore the device to the factory setting and is an
           irreversible operation

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary:
The local or network file path to write the RUM
                                   reports to.
post.description:
The local or network file path to write the RUM
                                   reports to.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/rpc:license`

file.description:
The local or network file path to write the RUM
                                   reports to.

days.description:
Save RUM reports that include measurements in the
                             specified number of days

trust-request.description:
The local or network file path to write
                           the trust request to.

add.description:
The feature name to get the authorization code for
                             The smart agent will look this up in it's mapping
                             table and get the proper entitlement tag for it.

replace.description:
The feature name to get the authorization code for
                             The smart agent will look this up in it's mapping
                             table and get the proper entitlement tag for it.

all.description:
If true perform the operation for all devices
                       in an HA configuration.

local.description:
If false then only establish
                       trust for the active device.

offline.description:
Returns a currently installed authorization
                             code offline.

online.description:
Returns a currently installed authorization
                             code online.
